Ecology, as an encompassing discipline, should be integrative and interactive rather than fragmented and isolated. I am not limited to any particular areas and always open to cool ideas that spark my interests.

I have years of experience in statistical analysis and modeling in R. I highly value these "weapons"â€”they offer me the ability to tackle the research questions I would like to answer. Now I still keep arming myself with new quantitative skills. Never stop learning!

I am also into data visualization: creating awesome ggplots for effective science communication certainly brings me a great source of joy and achievement!

<!-- To put it in a broad context, I would like to adopt **multiple approaches** (observational, experimental, and modeling) to examine how **multiple drivers** (abotic and biotic) affect **multi-trophic interactions** (primary producer, herbivore, predator, parasitoid, detritivore, and decomposer), and how these effects may scale up to influence the properties at **multiple biological levels of organization** (individual, population, community, and ecosystem) and over **multiple temporal and spatial scales** (organismal, ecological, and evolutionary; local, regional, geographical, and global). -->
